English:
Everything must be put to fire and sword, men, women and children and old men must be slaughtered and not a tree or house be left standing. 
Kaiser Wilhelm II in a letter to Kaiser Franz Joseph 
"burning homes, rounding up villagers--men, women, and in some cases children--and shooting groups of them: six at Warsage, fifty at Seilles, nearly four hundred at Tamines and over six hundred at Dinant. The medieval town of Louvain was heavily shelled and its university's library, a treasure-house of ancient manuscripts, was torched." 
Our war policies have encouraged our troops to commit several massacres in recently occupied territory.

Everything must be put to fire and sword, men, women and children and old men must be slaughtered and not a tree or house be left standing. 
Kaiser Wilhelm II in a letter to Kaiser Franz Joseph 
"burning homes, rounding up villagers--men, women, and in some cases children--and shooting groups of them: six at Warsage, fifty at Seilles, nearly four hundred at Tamines and over six hundred at Dinant. The medieval town of Louvain was heavily shelled and its university's library, a treasure-house of ancient manuscripts, was torched." 
Rampaging $COUNTRY_ADJ$ troops are burning down our villages and executing our civilians!
The Nian Rebellion

What began as groups of poor roaming peasants displaced by the 1851 Yellow River flood grew into larger and larger bandit gangs after years of Qing mismanagement. Finally, under Zhang Lexing, the bands were organized into a loose alliance of five banners of fast-moving Nian cavalry well suited to looting operations.
More rebel scum!
The Nian Rebellion

What began as groups of poor roaming peasants displaced by the 1851 Yellow River flood grew into larger and larger bandit gangs after years of Qing mismanagement. Finally, under Zhang Lexing, the bands were organized into a loose alliance of five banners of fast-moving Nian cavalry well suited to looting operations.
Welcome to the Revolution
The Chinese Rite

The Taiping have overthrown the Qing dynasty. They claim to be Christians, but their rituals are mixed with strange Chinese practices, and more worringly, their leader claims to be Jesus Christ's little brother! The Pope is considering how to respond to this development, and since we own Rome, we can influence the Holy See's decision.
The Taiping are heretics!
They believe in God too, do they not?
Taiping American Relations

The Taiping have overthrown the Qing dynasty. Since their leader, Hong Xiuquan, studied under the American Southern Baptist missionary, Reverend Issachar Jacox Roberts, American missionaries in China feel welcome by the new government! More American missionaries are on their way to China as we speak.
God has finally reached the Chinese.
Pro-Qing Intervention?

Chinese Rebels have overthrown the Qing dynasty, undoing our hard work opening China up to our merchants. However, reminants of the Qing court survive in Manchuria. Perhaps with our support the Qing could restore order in China. Our contacts in Manchuria say the Qing are ready to give us a consession if we succeed.
Supporting the Manchu would be advantageous
The Chinese should be left alone.
American Missionaries Arrive!
American missionaries, inspired by our nation's new Christian faith, have arrived in significant numbers, ready to help us spread the word of God.
Welcome them!
Discourage them and hope they leave. Our Christianization efforts will suffer, however.
The Pope Condemns the Taiping
The Pope condemned the Taiping for heresy! This is the perfect chance to show the Chinese their place and grab concessions from them.
We will crush those heretics!
We shouldn't waste our time with colonial adventures.
The Pope Accepts the Taiping
The Pope has declared that the Chinese rites are a philosophy and an integral part of Chinese culture rather than as a heathen religion in conflict with Catholicism.
Excellent news.
East Shantung Trade
The treaty ceding the port Weihaiwei to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
End of East Shantung Trade
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.
Good riddance.

Revolutionaries seeking to bring down the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ monarchy have been stirring up a revolt in $STATENAME$. The authorities have already ambushed and cracked down on rebel cells in $PROVINCENAME$ with the help of informants, but key revolutionaries remain at large.

Generals of the New Army warn that they will be unable to protect the Imperial Family if $CAPITAL$ were to fall, and claim they can negotiate a safe retirement with the rebels for Your Imperial Majesty if you were to please resign.
Tax Refund

In order to avoid a liquidity crisis, money is forcibly injected back into the economy while at peace. The max amount of money the treasury can hold is determined by population and Monetary System Technology. 
 No other conditions met: 3 mil ¤ 
 1 mil pops (4 mil population) OR Ad hoc Money: 6 mil ¤ 
 10 mil pops (40 mil population) OR Central Bank : 7.5 mil ¤ 
 100 mil pops (400 mil population) OR Market Determined Exchange: 12 mil ¤
